Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2009 06:50AM angeltam wrote: Sassyforever, It's sad but "Yes, there are many in waiting and jumping through hoops, going to appt after appt & being told we'll check it out in X amount of days/months". The worry and fear that runs through us all waiting to be DX is almost paralyzing or it is for me. I have even found some Breast Centers (at least one in my area) that is very cold & isn't up to date with the Breast Cancers out there that made me feel like just another "11 o'clock appointment". It seemed that unless I had a LUMP that JUMPED out I had nothing. As many have told me "YOU HAVE TO BE YOUR OWN BEST ADVOCATE" & "YOU KNOW YOUR BODY BETTER THAN ANYONE" . It took my insurance a year of testing silly things first & a very wonderful Dr. Broady had to fight with the insurance board to allow him to do a hysterectomy on me when I was 25. Because it took so long they were forced to take everything leaving me on Hormones since. It took me 5 doctors before finding that doctor, do NOT give up. Thinking of everyone and Praying for all. Angel
Posts.Title: IS this the best we can do? Sassy4ever Sassy4ever

Posts.Title: MRI done today.... angeltam kregley

Posts.Content: angeltam wrote: Hello everyone. I'm sorry that I went away and took all post off. I was already stressed and at a very emotional point with No answers and yet more symptom's popping up almost weekly and when I read something about me "not wanting help" or "wanting cancer"  that was my breaking point. I am sorry for those who've been such a wonderful support and I am very Thankful for you all. Now I have been waiting and trying to deal with life a day at a time. As of last week I've been getting more pain, my nipple is very dark almost black (left side), I have such awful pain in the breast and nipple. I ended up going to my GYN and was seen by another doctor there who ended up to be an Angel... She saw the difference in the color of the nipple (other is pale/white), saw the swollen look of the left breast, felt the firm feeling of the left breast and most importantly she felt the mass/lump/spot... It just came up last week but when it did it caused more pain than I ever thought I could handle. After she felt that she said "Get dressed we need to get you to a Breast Surgeon" . When we talked she told me that the long odd shape hard mass that I am feeling and that is causing so much pain is a Duct (12 o'clock position) and there is another on the bottom part of the same areola between the 5/6 position that is firm but not yet like the other. The area that is near that swollen Duct feels as if it's Bruised and I no longer even wash that breast daily but every other day because of the pain. I go tomorrow at 10am to see the Breast Surgeon. I don't like having this mass but at the same time I feel it will get me more answers than not having it but just having pain and swelling. Again Thank you all. I will let you know how it went and what they find. I hope you can understand that mini breakdown. Praying for you all daily, Angel Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 06:28AM angeltam wrote: Nancy I'm sorry you've been going through so much trouble I do pray you are doing better and enjoying life. I know I often feel like others think I'm a hypochondriac but I AM the one who is feeling this daily.... I also know that the doctors can see that it's "something" and they are getting test done. I do know Bridget, Nancy.... I am NOT giving up on getting answers until I'm feeling better and know why this is happening.  I don't know one person who would just "live with it" with no answers. I would've never believed that someone could go this long without an answers, that doctors would pass someone on, not call back or give up on someone... I now see from the other side and KNOW it can happen and does all too often. It's ashame but WE ALL OF US KNOW OUR BODIES and should be listen to. I know there really are some people out there with every ache run to thinking it's something awful or something but I also know there are MANY like me who don't run unless it's the last possible way to go, I have to go in today for the Nuclear Bone Scan because they said they didn't have that radioactive stuff (LOL!) that they put in your veins. I didn't mind waiting a day.  I'll let you all know when I know something though. GOD Bless
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 10:57AM angeltam wrote: Mary Jo and Bridget, Thank you for your post. I appreciate it more than you'll ever know. I'm Praying for answers and have faith in time they will come. Bridget I'm glad that you are port was removed and I'll be praying that they find you answers as well. I'm sorry that you have to know what it feels like waiting...... As for ranting... GO FOR IT! There is NOTHING at all wrong with it and gets some of the pressure off your shoulders. It's hard going on with life when you can't seem to ever feel comfortable because of discomfort and pain. It's not much of a life living like that either. I've heard way too many life stories now about how long it's taken someone to get relief from one disorder or another and to even be DX sometimes can take soooo long even YOU can start to feel like you're nuts..... I won't ever give up and would tell the same to EVERYONE else who is going through something like this. Giving up is NOT an option. I've even seen shows now called "MEDICAL MYSTERY'S" and as long a wait as I've had there are longer and there are doctors who'll get the answers. I am not alone... as sad at that is. I hope everyone is having a great week and the weekend gets even better. GOD Bless,
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2009 09:25PM angeltam wrote: Thank you Shirley, I've just had such a rough time and I too wish I could go somewhere else... I am just Praying and keeping faith that something WILL be done soon and reveal what this is. I've had doctors tell me that "It's NOT in your head" They sure didn't need to tell me that.... it's puzzling to my Dr. now but she's running test to find out what this is too. I am at a loss as to why they aren't removing this lump/mass (My GYN said she thinks  it's a Duct that's swollen) the Dr. who did the ultra sound said "She didn't see it but felt it and it COULD be scar tissue"; I've never had any there.... I can't see why they can't just remove it and just see. It's not like it's going to hurt to remove it and say "SEE SCAR TISSUE" IF it is.   I am almost at the end of my rope as well, I've been getting more tired the past few weeks, having no appetite and just feeling over all done.... I'm NOT giving up by no means. The pain/aches/discomfort is still there and I Thank GOD daily that I am still here as well. Tomorrow I get the results of the Nuclear Bone Scan. I really want to hear that they've seen and think. GOD Bless.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2009 04:12PM angeltam wrote: Yeah, they are moving and it's about time. The doctor did say "It just hasn't been so cut and dry but he'll get to the bottom of it for me and because he's just baffled now and wants to know". I've found that this doctor really does want to help and wasn't passing me on because he didn't want to help but because he wanted to rule stuff out. I will have to have many more test as to why my ANA test came back so high/elevated and I'm not worried about that at all because I know they WILL find out and help me. The white blood count being low... I'm not even worried about that because again I'm going to get answers and treatment whatever that may be. I can say today I feel such relief inside, such peace.... I am still in pain but KNOWING someone is doing something I am okay taking my medicine knowing I'm NOT masking it but giving myself a little less stress until we know what it is. Yeah, Vickie "Dip and Dot's" snow flakes!!! I couldn't believe it and I would've loved to have seen much more but it's gone, melted the same day. Next time I'm running to get my camera and taking pics. I'd love to have about 5 inches and send some your way too. I Love snow just not the cold, although I love the fall above all seasons. One more thing.... the doctor told me "Angel you know this biopsy is going to leave a is scar right" ... I wasn't sure why he said that but I told him "Doc, I don't care if leaves many scars I want this help and it's not like I walk around the streets without a shirt on, heck at this point I'd be okay with you taking the whole thing". Of course only if they had to. Thank you all and know I APPRECIATE ALL the advice and caring thoughts.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 01:00PM - edited Apr 15, 2009 01:26PM by angeltam I just found some info on the web and thought I'd share it......... "A surgical biopsy should find it. I too had a "no show" lump but could definitely feel it.  Doc found it during biopsy and it was cancer, much to everyone's surprise.  It is doubtful yours is cancer just because of the odds, but get it out anyway. My  doctor found a lump which did not show up on mammogram or ultrasound, even though we knew exactly where to look.  I was offered needle biopsy, core biopsy or just removal.  I chose the middle ground, core biopsy, which showed 1.7 cm of malignant tumor It was lobular instead of ductal which means it hides in the small milk-producing lobes and is very hard to detect."  So, at least I know again it's not just my US not showing up what we can all feel. Now the next step is to get a biopsy or at the very least take a look at it. The BS did say he would just waiting on my "call back". I seem to do a LOT of that.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 04:15PM angeltam wrote: I should have it done this coming week. I'm glad and hope that they'll be able to tell me what is going on and take care of it.  Jenny Would you like to come with me to a doctors appointment? Cause if you can get results I'D LOVE TO HAVE YOU. I've been out of my mind and wondering what the HELL too... How can any doctor allow this. I am doing ALL I can and not sure why this is going on but it is. I'm sorry you had to go through what you did and I'm so very happy that you were able to get the help you needed and fast. My prayer will continue to be for you to be cancer free. As soon as I know what is going on I will let you all know and until that time Thank you for the support. Anyone living near Knoxville Tennessee is welcome to come with me to a doctor appointment to see if another voice other than myself, my boyfriend and my doc. will help. Although as I said my insurance advocacy program is stepping in and we are waiting for the approval. State insurance isn't always great and sometimes takes awhile but when that is all you have it's better than nothing at all. I'm off for the weekend. Take care and  GOD Bless.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: May 1, 2009 09:52PM angeltam wrote: Thanks everyone. Bridget I didn't mean to worry you, I've just got no news and I've been down and trying to deal with the pain/discomfort. I'm at wits end knowing what to do now. I didn't get to see my PCP but will next week. I also have another Mammogram and ultra sound scheduled for the 20/21st. Praying that whatever this is will be seen with this next round of test. I can't sleep right now.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: May 4, 2009 11:03AM angeltam wrote: Lori, Jane & everyone else.... I hope that you ladies have had a wonderful weekend. Thank you for the prayers and support. I'm with you on getting a diagnosis no matter what is going on. I have an appointment on the 21st.   they say they couldn't get me in sooner.... They are going to do yet another Mammogram & U/S. I'm going to take all my records (papers from each doctor) and let the doctor see how in EACH report it states "something new" or "Not going away" and the good old "Wait 4 wks" & "keep an eye on this". I'm Praying that they can see what can be felt this time and do something anything about it. GOD Bless
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: May 7, 2009 09:48AM angeltam wrote: I am feeling very down trying not to get to down. I'm trying to tell myself "There is a reason for this wait". I've been feeling like my right hip/lower back (right side) is crushing when I lay on that side. I just don't lay down on that side right now. My next appointment is the 21st. at 9am. I'm not giving up on getting an answer. Thank you all for being so wonderful. God Bless
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 03:59AM angeltam wrote: Jane, Lori, Thank you very much for your thoughts, hugs and prayer. Time has been slow but I keep telling myself this is happening for a reason... One I can not understand or see but nonetheless I have to just go with it. I have an appointment this morning because of yet more problems. My wrist and hips have been hurting me (hips feel like they are crushing when I lay on my right side) I had an x-ray last week because my wrist has been hurting (haven't hurt it) but they said there was no break, fracture or sprain and put me on Naproxen, which has not helped. Well yesterday (around 5pm) my wrist got so bad that I couldn't even move it, after awhile I was able to move it but the pain is awful when trying to move it or lift anything. So, this morning I go in to see WHAT is going on now..... I'm too young to be falling apart.   I've been going to the Mountains (My Grandma passed away and we now have her home) which is in the middle of nowhere at the top of a mountain. It's so nice and peaceful, deer all over, wild turkey, cows and birds singing all the time. I Love it! It really does help. Know that I am thinking of all of you and Praying for you all as well. I'm very Blessed to have found this site with such wonderful ladies.

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2009 04:49AM angeltam wrote: Bridget, Linda and everyone else following..... Today is my appointment. I called my GP's office for my blood work results and by the end of the day no one had called me back so I called them... the nurse said "Angel I'm sorry I'll give those to you, let me just pull them up". Next thing I know after Thanking her she made a 180 switch to "Angel your white blood count is way off, the ANA is......  the doctor will have to call you back with these results I can't give them to you" I questioned why and she said "Angel the doctor will want to give you these results and talk with you in person. I'm sorry I can't give them to you, I, I... call in the morning when we open and we'll get you in" I told her I had an appointment with my BS and she said "Good have him call the doctor so she can give him these results". I'm not sure what to think about that but I am UPSET at the fact she didn't look at that before making me worry all night about "What are the results of the white blood count low or high, ANA results pos or what" What would a positive ANA test mean?  Not that it matters too much seeing I'm calling them at 8:30 and I still have my BS appt. at 10am. Thank you so much for the kind words. I'll let you know what they say.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2009 10:54AM angeltam wrote: Thank you all. I really have just been through hell and I wish I could say it's just me going through this but I am learning MANY women are going through what I am. I am by no means strong but I Thank you for believing that. I was ready many times to just have a breakdown, get in bed and not leave, Heck I was ready at one point when the doctors said "We can't give you anything for pain until we know what it is" but no one was testing anything to find out..... I was ready to find someone with pain pills and buy them BUT that is NOT me and I knew how wrong it was and how irrational my thinking was, I had to step back and remember who I AM. That made me so mad at myself and them that I was almost ready to compromise my beliefs, values and morals that it made me FIGHT/PUSH even harder until I get results. I called my insurance company and the advocate working for/with them. I even got a call from them this morning asking what the next step was and what they could do for me. I really feel like I am on my way to answers to what this is. I would like to say I do pray this is B9 but for those who say "The biopsy didn't show Cancer" Look on THIS site and you will see that sometimes IF they don't do a Punch Biopsy in the right spot it CAN be missed. Now with that being said..... I don't know at this point that this is Cancer and my thoughts are it isn't but I along with everyone else do NOT know what it is therefore I am NOT going to stop until someone can tell me what is happening to me. I'll let you all know what is said when I get back. I'm on my way in a second. Lot's of Prayers for B9 results for those waiting, Prayers for those who are in treatment for a FULL recovery, A Life CANCER FREE and for No one to ever have to wait as long as many of us have.

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 03:21AM angeltam wrote: Jennywren, I agree with you 100% and that is why I'm so emotional So, as to what the "Doctors" say about it "not being cancer" Thats all wonderful but it doesn't take away from what I am going through and that the problem is still there and NOT getting better. I've even considered writing to that show "Mystery Diagnosis". It's a sad fact NOT all doctors are as fast as you are, I've been told to try many many different things ALL of which failed to work, I've been sent from one doctor to another and back to the "Breast Surgeon"... ALL doctors agree "Something is going one no doubt but they don't know what it is"..... My last GYN is the one who wants this OUT she says "You may not be able to see it but everyone can sure feel it which means we can go in and take it out". What it is..... Is that if it's not cut and dry out of the "Medical Book" cancer or deadly it's not in need of surgery and there is time to "Rule out" one by one everything else. When this is all over and I have faith that someone WILL get me an answer and treat this but I'll let you know. As for everyone else I want to Thank you for the on going support, encouragement and advice, it is much appreciated. I'm keeping you all in my prayers daily.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2009 04:46AM angeltam wrote: Karen Thanks for the info. I just don't understand but at this point I don't care because I'm NOT the only one feeling it but several doctors.  Vickie, I hope you didn't mind me adding you to my post.... I just knew you too haven't gotten true answers yet. I thought "ruling out" the implants which seem to mean it makes you less of a person/worry to doctors would help me to get results but as you know all to well... it does NOT and implants are still on the mind of those doctors. Due time though, OUR (everyone waiting) time WILL come and we'll get healthy again. If no one calls by Wed. my insurance advocacy person ask for me to call her back and she'll get me a biopsy come hell of high water. LOL! Although she is an advocate with my insurance she is NOT the one to "approve" but to push for it to be approved.  So, this mass/limp IS coming out. I'm done guessing and way past ready to know.  Thoughts and Prayers are with all those waiting and those in treatment.

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 09:15AM angeltam wrote: Thanks Leaf and Kim... Tomorrow is the date for the new Mammo & US. Praying they get to the bottom of things. I've had bad pain in my wrist with limited movement (feels like the bone) as well as the hip pain that comes and goes..... my X-ray showed nothing, my inflammation markers showed nothing but they set me up for a Bone Scan with contrast this Friday in the morning. They feel like it could be the start of arthritis.... I feel like I'm falling apart that's for sure. Trying not to worry about it too much and Thanking the LORD daily for what I do have. I'll let you know when I know something more. Thank you so much everyone. My thoughts and prayers are with you all.
Posts.Title: New info.... angeltam PS73

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 04:19PM angeltam wrote: I agree with you 100% Digger.... My doctors would NOT be doing all this for NOTHING... Which means they know something is going on and trying to figure out what it is. I know for a fact that they want to know as much as I do what this is and Dr. White has said "She will get to the bottom of it". I don't think she'd do it for kicks. The Osteopenia was already told to me but from what I understand this is NOT what has now shown up on this scan. The scan before this was a Bone Density Scan" and this one was a "Nuclear Bone Scan" of the whole body. I am also aware it can be taken care of and have already started towards that but it sure doesn't take away the other problems that I am told wouldn't be caused' by OSTEOPENIA. As for just going on... I would love to see you go on with pain and discomfort daily and just live life. So, let things go.......... Hmmmmm.... I'd also like to add "I am living daily and taking care of life as it comes until I get answers, What more would you like for me to do or not do? I'm not upset with what you say because YOU won't know what this is like until you go through it and I PRAY you never have to go through any of this. May GOD continue to Bless you. Leaf the scan was easy and it was good to know that something was seen... I know that sounds bad but it's good when everything seems so dark with all other test. The ANA test are still very elevated, my iron is low now and I will have further blood test to compare them to. Two ANA's so far and both elevated (high).

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2009 06:06AM angeltam wrote: Bridget, Lori, Thanks for the support. I have been to so many doctors from the Dermatologist, Immunologist and all of them sent me back to the "BS". My GP sent me to another BS and I have documents that state "IBC must be considered and ruled out" and I have documents that state "I recommend a biopsy be done" YES, all those and the one doctor "Lewis" who is proving to be very helpful but he to can only move as fast as my insurance will allow him; he did my 1st Punch Biopsy that showed up as "Dermal Fibrosis" which has been left not sure why... Something is causing this scaring in the tissue but we aren't sure what. The next step is to do a biopsy of the new mass/lump that my GYN believes is a swollen duct. I "DID" believe this was cancer when it started although I now am just so unsure but MY GUT does tell me SOMETHING IS VERY WRONG and the last time it did... I ended up getting a total Hysterectomy and that took many doctors as well and even a visit to a therapist who told me i"It's not in your head, you don't need me you need medical attention". I hate to say "I'm not alone" because it just means others are going through this. Look at "Vickie" she (as with me) was told it was the implants for sooo long (I got mine ruled out by testing) she has thickening and many other symptoms as well and she is still getting the run around, she has taken a BIG step to get her implants removed (which she believed wasn't the problem but wanted to get them out so Dr's couldn't keep using that) and now she is STILL in the same shape as she was before. So, it's not just me and there are "Doctors" out there that don't JUMP when someone says "JUMP", that aren't as educated as others (as they should be) and that don't see what might be unless it's some HUGE HARD MASS jumping out at them. Cancer or not it still interferes with the life and it still causes pain and still needs help.  I PRAY it's some odd infection.. I've had many blood test and been on many antibiotics, creams and anti-inflammatory med's . I'm NOT giving up because I want my life back and I want answers. I've even thought about (before knowing they are going to do a biopsy of that mass) asking to see an Infectious disease specialist. I do feel comfortable with Dr. Lewis and believe he'll take care of this. Right now I am at the Beach with my boyfriend (he's at a coaching clinic) and I've been trying to relax... some might think how nice but even this isn't enjoyable because of the pain/discomfort. THIS is why I'm NOT going to stop until I get answers and HEALED! I really do Pray for everyone on this site daily and will continue to. You are true Angel's on this board. THANKS.

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2009 11:31AM angeltam wrote: Yes the doctor did try but I have no lumps. With IBC there aren't always lumps and that is why it's missed so often and thought to be "Breast Infections" . More often then not  a Mammo, Ultra Sound or MRI can NOT spot IBC but instead a "Deep tissue Biopsy" is needed. Although my Lymph-nodes in my armpit and around my neck are all swollen. If you feel it is something PUSH to get something done ASAP. Praying for B9 results for you as well.
